net.finmath.montecarlo.automaticdifferentiation

Class MonteCarloBlackScholesModelDigitalOptionAADRegressionSensitivitiesTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.finmath.montecarlo.automaticdifferentiation.MonteCarloBlackScholesModelDigitalOptionAADRegressionSensitivitiesTest

  • public class MonteCarloBlackScholesModelDigitalOptionAADRegressionSensitivitiesTest
extends Object
    This test checks several methods for calculating the delta of a digital option. Among the methods is the calculation via AAD with regression, see Stochastic Algorithmic Differentiation of (Expectations of) Discontinuous Functions (Indicator Functions). https://ssrn.com/abstract=3282667 The test shows that the method provides a significant improvement in the quality (in terms of variance reduction): AAD is 8 time better than finite differences, AAD with regression is 3 times better than AAD Likelihood Ratio (the benchmark for a digital option) is only 6% better than AAD with regression.
    Author:
    Christian Fries

      • getModel

        public MonteCarloAssetModel getModel(RandomVariableFactory abstractRandomVariableFactory,
                                     BrownianMotion brownianMotion)
        Create a Monte-Carlo simulation of a Black-Scholes model using a specified Brownian motion and random variable factory. The random variable factory will control the use of AAD (by means of dependency injection).
        Parameters:
        abstractRandomVariableFactory - The random variable factory to be used.
        brownianMotion - The Brownian motion used to drive the model.
        Returns:
        A Monte-Carlo simulation of a Black-Scholes model.

        CalculationException
